response.original_title: Show Me from Behind the Wall
response.overview: After several years of distance, Mary Jane agrees to reunite with a group of former friends for a trip meant to offer reconnection and rest. However, the reunion quickly becomes uncomfortable. Old wounds, unresolved conflicts, and buried secrets begin to surface, turning the experience into an increasingly tense and claustrophobic one. Isolated in a house far from the city, the women are forced to confront the past and face the emotional consequences of deep trauma. Mary Jane’s instability becomes progressively more apparent: her silence, restrained gestures, and the way she observes the others reveal a mind shaped by trauma, guilt, and obsession. Trapped between memories that refuse to fade and a desperate need for control, Mary Jane begins to confuse protection with punishment, love with violence. The film offers a disturbing portrait of the psychological deterioration of a woman pushed to her limits, where sanity dissolves and nothing is exactly as it seems.
response.tagline: Some things are meant to be seen. Others are meant to be read.
response.title: Show me from behind the wall
